name: NEONATAL NUTRITION DIGITAL ACCELERATOR KIT PROJECT
description: The Newborn Nutrition Digital Adaptation Kit (NNDAK) system is intelligently designed using Human-Centered Design to support healthcare delivery through actively tracking, measuring and troubleshooting the feeding of vulnerable babies. The NNDAK features data collection and visualization and a major innovation that entails the babies growth chart, leveraging on the publicly available data on INTERGROWTH-21ST fetal weight Charts. The NNDAK is envisioned to streamline data collection for newborn nutrition to aid in decision-making. The data will equip mothers and health care providers with information and real-time feedback to adapt practices to optimize the provision of lifesaving milk to newborns. Guided by the WHO Standards-Based, Machine-readable, Adaptive, Requirements-based and Testable (SMART) guideline in conjunction with the Principles for Digital Development, to ensure better success in its design, development, deployment, use, support and maintenance in a sustainable manner, the NNDAK is built on Google’s Android Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources Software Development Kit.

SDGs.evidenceText: The main aim of this project is to streamline data collection for newborn nutrition to aid in decision-making. The data will equip mothers and health care providers with information and real-time feedback to adapt practices to optimize the provision of lifesaving milk to newborns. This system will primarily support infant feeding through the mother’s own milk or donor human milk.
